intro: Solandra capensis, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange or yellow tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Solandra capensis is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun.
